user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_FileOpenCheck:
```c
int32 OS_FileOpenCheck(const char *Filename)
{
    int32                        return_code;
    OS_object_iter_t             iter;
    OS_stream_internal_record_t *stream;

    /* Check parameters */
    OS_CHECK_POINTER(Filename);

    return_code = OS_ERROR;

    OS_ObjectIdIterateActive(LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE, &iter);

    while (OS_ObjectIdIteratorGetNext(&iter))
    {
        stream = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_stream_table, iter.token);
        if (stream->socket_domain == OS_SocketDomain_INVALID && (strcmp(stream->stream_name, Filename) == 0))
        {
            return_code = OS_SUCCESS;
            break;
        }
    }

    OS_ObjectIdIteratorDestroy(&iter);

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_FileOpenCheck:
#define OS_CHECK_POINTER(ptr) BUGCHECK((ptr)!=NULL,OS_INVALID_POINTER)
...
int32 OS_ObjectIdIterateActive(osal_objtype_t objtype, OS_object_iter_t *iter)
{
    return OS_ObjectIdIteratorInit(OS_ObjectFilterActive, NULL, objtype, iter);
}
...
bool OS_ObjectIdIteratorGetNext(OS_object_iter_t *iter)
{
    OS_common_record_t *record;
    bool                got_next;

    got_next           = false;
    iter->token.obj_id = OS_OBJECT_ID_UNDEFINED;

    do
    {
        ++iter->token.obj_idx;
        if (iter->token.obj_idx >= iter->limit)
        {
            break;
        }

        record = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(iter->base, iter->token);
        if (iter->match == NULL || iter->match(iter->arg, &iter->token, record))
        {
            iter->token.obj_id = record->active_id;
            got_next           = true;
        }
    } while (!got_next);

    return got_next;
}
...
void OS_ObjectIdIteratorDestroy(OS_object_iter_t *iter)
{
    OS_ObjectIdTransactionCancel(&iter->token);
}
...
typedef struct
{
    OS_common_record_t * base;
    OS_ObjectMatchFunc_t match;
    void *               arg;
    osal_index_t         limit;
    OS_object_token_t    token;
} OS_object_iter_t
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
...
static inline osal_index_t OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    return token->obj_idx;
}
...
OS_stream_internal_record_t OS_stream_table[OS_MAX_NUM_OPEN_FILES]
...
typedef struct
{
    char   stream_name[OS_MAX_PATH_LEN];
    uint8  socket_domain;
    uint8  socket_type;
    uint16 stream_state;
} OS_stream_internal_record_t
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
...
#define OS_ERROR (-1)
...
void OS_printf(const char *String, ...)
{
    va_list va;
    char    msg_buffer[OS_BUFFER_SIZE];
    int     actualsz;

    BUGCHECK_VOID(String != NULL)

    if (OS_SharedGlobalVars.GlobalState != OS_INIT_MAGIC_NUMBER)
    {
        /*
         * Catch some historical mis-use of the OS_printf() call.
         *
         * Typically OS_printf() should NOT be called before OS_API_Init().
         *
         * This was never guaranteed to work, particularly on a VxWorks
         * deployment where the utility task was enabled.
         *
         * However, some PSPs do this, particularly those that used POSIX
         * where it happened to work (because OS_printf just called printf).
         *
         * As a workaround, use the OS_DEBUG facility to dump the message,
         * along with a clue that this API is being used inappropriately.
         *
         * If debugging is not enabled, then this message will be silently
         * discarded.
         */
        OS_DEBUG("BUG: OS_printf() called when OSAL not initialized: %s", String);
    }
    else if (OS_SharedGlobalVars.PrintfEnabled)
    {
        /* Format and determine the size of string to write */
        va_start(va, String);
        actualsz = vsnprintf(msg_buffer, sizeof(msg_buffer), String, va);
        va_end(va);

        if (actualsz < 0)
        {
            /* unlikely: vsnprintf failed */
            actualsz = 0;
        }
        else if (actualsz >= OS_BUFFER_SIZE)
        {
            /* truncate */
            actualsz = OS_BUFFER_SIZE - 1;
        }

        msg_buffer[actualsz] = 0;

        OS_ConsoleWrite(OS_SharedGlobalVars.PrintfConsoleId, msg_buffer);
    }
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: The fragments listed above are those that plausibly affect reachability or may conceal unreachable code and therefore should be investigated: the pointer-check macro (OS_CHECK_POINTER) and BUGCHECK_VOID may abort/longjmp/terminate and thus can make following code unreachable; the while-loop body in OS_FileOpenCheck contains a conditional break/return_code assignment that affects loop exit and cleanup; the iterator implementation lines (initializing token.obj_id and the obj_idx >= limit break) control loop termination and can create paths where some statements are never reached; and the OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET macro performs an address-of on its token parameter which can alter expression evaluation and indexing semantics. Other fragments in the supplied code were not included because they are simple, directly reachable constructs or trivial wrappers and do not present obvious unconditional or constant-false/true branches that would make code unreachable. Examples of non-suspect code not reported: simple typedef/struct definitions, constant macros for OS_SUCCESS/OS_ERROR, the thin wrapper OS_ObjectIdIterateActive calling OS_ObjectIdIteratorInit, OS_ObjectIdIteratorDestroy calling a single cancel function, the inline OS_ObjectIndexFromToken returning token->obj_idx, and the normal formatted-output branch within OS_printf (it is guarded by runtime flags rather than by constant conditions). These omitted fragments do not contain constructs that imply compile-time or unconditional runtime unreachability based on the provided code.
